# CurrentValueSubject

**Class**

A subject that wraps a single value and publishes a new element whenever the value changes.

## Declaration

```swift
final class CurrentValueSubject<Output, Failure> where Failure : Error
```

## Overview

Unlike [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject], [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/CurrentValueSubject] maintains a buffer of the most recently published element.

Calling [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subject/send(_:)] on a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/CurrentValueSubject] also updates the current value, making it equivalent to updating the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/CurrentValueSubject/value] directly.

## Creating a current value subject

- **init(_:)**: Creates a current value subject with the given initial value.

## Accessing the current value

- **value**: The value wrapped by this subject, published as a new element whenever it changes.

## Subjects

- **Subject**: A publisher that exposes a method for outside callers to publish elements.
- **PassthroughSubject**: A subject that broadcasts elements to downstream subscribers.

## Conforms To

- Publisher
- Subject
